verses.english: On the other side, Bacchides and his leaders set up camp and encamped in the land of Judea.

verses.latin: Et ploraverunt Iudaei, et dixerunt: Quomodo perierunt fortes, qui salvabant Israhel!
verses.english: The Jews mourned and said, "How have the strong ones perished, who saved Israel!"

verses.latin: Reliqua autem verborum Iudae, et bellorum eius, et virtutum, quae fecit, non sunt scripta in libro. Erat enim magna nimis.
verses.english: The rest of Judas’ deeds, his wars, and the acts of valor he performed are not written in this book, because they were too great.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post mortem Iudae, surrexerunt qui non erant pii, et moverunt omnem malitiam in omni finium Israhel.
verses.english: After the death of Judas, those who were not pious arose and stirred up all sorts of evil throughout all the borders of Israel.

verses.latin: Et congregata est omnis malitia in eos. Tunc surrexerunt qui faciebant peccata, et mali confabulationes adveniebant.
verses.english: All wickedness gathered against them. Then those who committed sins arose, and evil conspiracies followed.

verses.latin: Et facta est fames magna, et defecit terra, et congregata est omnis multitudo. Tunc Simon exsurrexit, et pugnavit pro populo suo, et obtulit vitam suam pro genere suo.
verses.english: A great famine occurred, and the land failed, and all the multitude gathered together. Then Simon rose up, fought for his people, and offered his life for his nation.

verses.latin: Et congregavit amicos suos, et misit eos: et congregavit eos qui erant de genere suo, et confirmavit eis iustitiam.
verses.english: He gathered his friends and sent them forth. He gathered those of his own family and strengthened them in justice.

verses.latin: Et multiplicavit opera populi, et terra fuit gloriosa, et omnis malitia expulsus est de terra.
verses.english: He multiplied the works of the people, and the land was glorified, and all evil was driven out of the land.

verses.latin: Et exsurrexit in conspectu eius de populo, et vindicavit genus suum. Et congregavit opera populi, et vindicavit eam.
verses.english: He arose in the sight of his people and avenged his nation. He gathered the works of the people and avenged it.

verses.latin: Et in diebus suis prosperatus est in operibus suis, et extulit fines suos.
verses.english: In his days, he prospered in his works and extended his borders.

verses.latin: His autem rebus gestis, Judas Machabaeus, et qui cum eo erant, introierunt clam in vicos, et accersierunt eos qui erant in Judaea, qui non recesserant ad Philippum, et celebrarunt diem sabbati.
verses.english: After this, Judas Maccabaeus and his men entered the villages in secret, and they summoned those in Judea who had not deserted to Philip. And they observed the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: Et postea, congregati, dederunt Philippo bellum, et contrito eo, et ipso cum magna virtute occiso, et ceteris qui cum eo erant.
verses.english: Later, they gathered and made war against Philip. After Philip was defeated and killed with great valor, and the rest who were with him...

verses.latin: Judas vero, et fratres ejus, cum optimis quibusque Israel, statuerunt in die illa, et secuti sunt.
verses.english: Judas and his brothers, along with the best of the Israelites, resolved on that day and followed this course:

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Ecce inimici nostri contriti sunt, et ascendamus ad mundationem sanctuarii, et dedicemus illud.
verses.english: They said: “Behold, our enemies are defeated! Let us go up to cleanse the sanctuary and dedicate it.”

verses.latin: Congregata est ergo universa multitudo, et ascenderunt in montem Sion.
verses.english: Then, the whole multitude gathered and went up to Mount Zion.

verses.latin: Et viderunt sanctuarium desertum, et altare contaminatum, et portas combustas, et in atriis plantas natas, sicut in silva vel in monte, et camerulas dirutas.
verses.english: They saw the sanctuary deserted, the altar defiled, the gates burned, and plants growing in the courtyards as in a forest or a mountain, and the chambers destroyed.

verses.latin: Et sciderunt vestimenta sua, et planxerunt planctu magno, et cinxerunt se ciliciis, et posuerunt cinis super capita sua.
verses.english: They tore their garments and mourned with a great lamentation; they put on sackcloth and placed ashes on their heads.

verses.latin: Et prociderunt in faciem terrae, et clamaverunt in voce magna ad caelum.
verses.english: And they fell to the ground and cried out with a loud voice to the universe.

verses.latin: Tunc Judas jussit viros pugnare adversus eos qui erant in castello, donec purgarent sanctuarium.
verses.english: Then Judas ordered the men to fight against those in the fortress until they had cleansed the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Et elegit sacerdotes sine macula, et voluntate bona, et mundaverunt sanctuarium, et tulerunt lapides contaminationis in locum immundum.
verses.english: He chose priests without blemish and of good will, and they cleansed the sanctuary and removed the stones of defilement to an unclean place.

verses.latin: Et consiliati sunt de altari holocaustorum, quod contaminatum erat, quid facerent de illo.
verses.english: They considered what to do with the altar of burnt offerings, which had been defiled.

verses.latin: Et obtulit illis consilium bonum, ut destruerent illud, ne forte eis inproperaretur, quod gentiles illud contaminassent: et demoliti sunt altare.
verses.english: They gave good counsel to tear it down, lest it be reproached to them that the Gentiles had defiled it, and they demolished the altar.

verses.latin: Et reposuerunt lapides in monte domus in loco conveniente, donec scilicet veniret propheta, et daret responsa de illis.
verses.english: They placed the stones in a fitting place on the mountain of the house until, that is, a prophet should come and give an answer about them.

verses.latin: Sumpserunt autem lapides integros secundum legem, et aedificaverunt altare secundum ea quae prius fuerant.
verses.english: Then they took whole stones according to the law and built an altar like the former one.

verses.latin: Et aedificaverunt sanctuarium, et quae intra erant domum, et atria sanctificaverunt.
verses.english: And they built the sanctuary and the interior of the house, and they sanctified the courts.

verses.latin: Et fecerunt vasa sancta nova, et intulerunt candelabrum et altare incensi, et mensam in templo.
verses.english: They made new sacred vessels and brought in the lampstand, the altar of incense, and the table in the temple.

verses.latin: Et incenderunt incensum in altari, et lucernas, quae erant super candelabrum, accenderunt, et inluminabant in templo.
verses.english: And they burned incense on the altar, and they lit the lamps that were on the lampstand, and they gave light in the temple.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt panes super mensam, et vela texuerunt, et perfecerunt opera quae fecerant.
verses.english: They placed the bread on the table and hung the veils, and they finished the work they had done.

verses.latin: Et in die vicesima quinta mensis noni, est dedicatio templi.
verses.english: On the twenty-fifth day of the ninth month was the dedication of the temple.

verses.latin: Et immolaverunt sacrificia cum cantico et citharis et cymbals, et in tympanis.
verses.english: And they offered sacrifices with song, with harps, cymbals, and drums.

verses.latin: Et ceciderunt sacerdotes in faciem ante templum, in dedicatione templi, et Levitae cum citharis et canticis in magno cantico.
verses.english: And the priests fell on their faces before the temple during the dedication of the temple, and the Levites sang with harps and songs in a great chant.

verses.latin: Et universus populus adoravit.
verses.english: And all the people adored.

verses.latin: Et sacrificaverunt holocausta, et immolaverunt hostias, et sacrificium pacis.
verses.english: And they sacrificed burnt offerings and offered sacrifices and peace offerings.

verses.latin: Et celebravit Judas dedicationem altaris in diebus octo, et obtulit holocausta, et libamina cum gaudio et laetitia.
verses.english: And Judas celebrated the dedication of the altar for eight days, and he offered burnt offerings and libations with joy and gladness.

verses.latin: Ornamenta templi quoque et ipsius templi, renovaverunt, et intus et foris.
verses.english: They also renewed the ornaments of the temple itself, both inside and out.

verses.latin: Et in die vicesima quinta mensis noni, et in anno centesimo quadragesimo octavo, surrexerunt mane.
verses.english: On the twenty-fifth day of the ninth month, in the one hundred and forty-eighth year, they rose early.

verses.latin: Et immolaverunt secundum legem, in altari holocaustorum, quod aedificaverant.
verses.english: And they sacrificed according to the law on the altar of burnt offerings, which they had built.

verses.latin: Et secundum tempus, et secundum diem, quo gentes contaminassent illud, in eodem dedicata est cum canticis, et citharis, et cymbals, et tympanis.
verses.english: And according to the time and day when the Gentiles had defiled it, it was dedicated with songs, harps, cymbals, and drums.

verses.latin: Et omnis populus procidit in faciem suam, et adoravit, et benedixerunt in caelum eum qui prosperaverat eis.
verses.english: And all the people fell on their faces, and adored, and they blessed the one in the universe who had given them success.

verses.latin: Et egerunt dedicationem altaris octo diebus in gaudio, sicut et in sollemnitate tabernaculorum memores facti, quoniam nuper, in tabernaculis silvarum conversati erant, et bestias feras patibantur.
verses.english: And they celebrated the dedication of the altar for eight days in joy, just as they were reminded of the feast of the tabernacles; because recently, they had lived in the tabernacles of the forests and endured wild beasts.

verses.latin: Propter quod et cum tirmis clamoribus, deprecati sunt eum qui prosperaverat eos, ut usque in finem conservaret ipsos.
verses.english: Because of this, they cried out with firm shouts, and they implored the one who had given them success to preserve them to the end.

verses.latin: Et Judas, et fratres ejus, constituerunt universae Judaeorum universitati, ut dies dedicationis altaris, in temporibus suis, annuatim cum gaudio et laetitia, celebrantur in diebus octo.
verses.english: And Judas and his brothers established for the whole community of the Jews that the days of the dedication of the altar should be celebrated annually with joy and gladness for eight days, at their appointed times.

verses.latin: Insuper et tempus illud, in quo fuerunt in Persida, et cum Artaxerse rege, et in tempore Machabaei.
verses.english: Moreover, this time, in which they were in Persia, and with King Artaxerxes, and in the time of Maccabaeus...

verses.latin: Et miserunt epistolas ad Judaeos, qui erant in Aegypto, in omnibus provinciis Judaeorum, salutem Judaeorum fratrum, Judaeorum, qui erant in Judaea, et qui erant, salutem.
verses.english: And they sent letters to the Jews who were in Egypt, to all the provinces of the Jews, greetings from the Jewish brothers—to the Jews who were in Judea, and those who were, greetings.

verses.latin: Et in dedicatione altaris, et in die vicesima quinta mensis Casleu, et in anno centesimo quadragesimo octavo.
verses.english: On the dedication of the altar, and on the twenty-fifth day of the month of Chislev, in the one hundred and forty-eighth year...

verses.latin: Et ea quae in Machabaeis gesta sunt et cum sociis ejus, universa declaramus, et de fortitudine et magna patientia.
verses.english: We declare all the events that occurred in Maccabees and with his companions, and of their strength and great endurance.

verses.latin: Quomodo in bello Judaeos adfecerunt, et quomodo pro Judaica lege cum virtute pugnantes, propterea inimici, et quomodo templum sanctum, et sanctuarium purificaverunt, et altare dedicaverunt.
verses.english: How they affected the Jews in war, and how they fought with courage for the Jewish law, how, for that reason, they were enemies, and how they purified the holy temple and the sanctuary, and they dedicated the altar.

verses.latin: Et quae de aliis facta sunt, et de his, in eisdem temporibus, narrabimus.
verses.english: And we will narrate what was done about the others, and about these, in those same times.

verses.latin: Et haec quidem dicta sint in verbo; nunc ergo finem faciemus sermonem.
verses.english: And let these things have been said in words; now, therefore, we will bring the speech to an end.

verses.latin: Maccabaeus autem et qui cum eo erant, Domino deprecati, petebant ut Deus hostibus suis hostem dimitteret.
verses.english: But Judas Maccabaeus and his men prayed to the Lord, begging Him to send an enemy against their enemies.

verses.latin: Et impetus factus est in eos, in quo complures vulnerati sunt, et reliqui fugerunt in loca montana.
verses.english: A surprise attack was launched against them, in which many were wounded, and the rest fled to the mountains.

verses.latin: Tunc igitur Simon, in cujus erant potentia, accepit viros, et eligens de numero suo, misit ad regem, ut inducerent eum in locos montium.
verses.english: Then Simon, who was one of their leaders, took his men, and selecting some of their number, he sent them to the king to bring him into the mountains.

verses.latin: Et fecit in eo viam, cum suis hominibus, et praeveniens, irruit in eos.
verses.english: He prepared a path for his men, anticipating the enemy, and rushed upon them.

verses.latin: Qui autem erant cum Timotheo, videbant ipsum et, cunctatione plena, confugerunt.
verses.english: Those with Timothy saw this and, filled with fear, took refuge.

verses.latin: Et exclamabant ad eum et supplicabant ut securius ad eos transiret: timuerunt enim.
verses.english: They cried out to him and begged him to let them pass safely, for they were afraid.

verses.latin: Tunc ergo venit ad eos et eos pacificavit, et juramenta ei dedit ut iniquos, qui essent, non inferrent eis.
verses.english: So he went to them and made peace with them, and they swore an oath that they would not cause any trouble.

verses.latin: Et concidit Timotheum et ipsius, et fratrem ejus Cheream, et reliquos, et persecuti sunt eos.
verses.english: He struck Timothy and his men, and his brother Chereas, and the rest, and pursued them.

verses.latin: Et in bellis erant praeparati, et ex insidiis dederunt pugnam: et occisi sunt ex eis circiter viginti millia virorum.
verses.english: They were prepared for war, and they gave battle from an ambush, and about twenty thousand men were killed.

verses.latin: Timotheus autem ipse, et ad ipsius locum, ut praepararentur, et ad aliud locum contra eos misit.
verses.english: Timothy himself, and to his place, sent to prepare, and to another place against them.

verses.latin: Maccabaeus autem et cum eo erant, divisus in duas turmas, egerunt, et aggressi sunt eos qui habebant praeparationem, et ad pugnam conflixerunt: et vulnerati sunt, et fugerunt reliqui in munitionem locorum.
verses.english: But Maccabaeus and those with him, divided into two groups, attacked those who were prepared, and they fought: and they were wounded, and the rest fled to the fortified places.

verses.latin: Ibi Timotheum ceperunt, et Cheream fratrem ipsius, et Apollonium. Et post haec interfecerunt eos, et gladiis multos vulneratos sunt.
verses.english: They captured Timothy there, and his brother Chereas, and Apollonius. And after this they killed them, and wounded many with swords.

verses.latin: Fuit autem pascha in mense Xanti, et cum venerat, celebraverunt illud.
verses.english: Now the Passover was in the month of Xanti, and when it came, they celebrated it.

verses.latin: Post haec, in castellum accedentes, quod erat sub montibus, nomine Garizim, complures ex iis qui erant in eo, interfecerunt.
verses.english: After this, they went to a fortress that was under the mountains, named Garizim, and they killed many of those who were in it.

verses.latin: Et in hoc tempore, Is, qui in Bethsuris, cum esset praesidii, confugerunt contra eos, et deprecabantur Dominum.
verses.english: And at this time, those who were in Bethsura, having been in the garrison, took refuge against them, and they prayed to the Lord.

verses.latin: Et pugnabant contra eos, et dederunt manum eis: et in hoc tempore, erant, qui ab eis exprobrabantur ab impiis.
verses.english: And they fought against them, and gave them their hand: and at this time, there were those who were reproached by the impious among them.

verses.latin: Et celebrabant sancta, et cum suis praesidiis, et ibi erant, qui erant de Bethsuris.
verses.english: And they celebrated the holy things with their garrisons, and there were those who were from Bethsura.

verses.latin: Erat enim dies celebrandi sancti, in mense Xanti, et in mense antequam, de quo ante dixeramus.
verses.english: For it was the day of celebrating the holy things, in the month of Xanti, and in the month before that, which we mentioned before.

verses.latin: Hii autem qui erant in Hierusalem, secuti sunt illos qui in Galilaea fuerant, qui in eodem mense Xanti, et celebrabant.
verses.english: Now those who were in Jerusalem followed those who had been in Galilee, who in the same month of Xanti, were celebrating.

verses.latin: Et postquam resurgentes, circumdederunt castra Judae, qui pugnaverant, et post haec.
verses.english: And after rising up, they surrounded the camp of Judas, who had fought, and after this.

verses.latin: Et ad Hierusalem venerunt, et supplicantes, oraverunt ut digne, et de virtute, esset cum eis, et ut ad finem pervenirent.
verses.english: And they came to Jerusalem, and supplicating, they prayed that they might be worthy, and with virtue, and to the end they would arrive.

verses.latin: Et post haec, in castra accesserunt, et in eis, erant qui contra eos erant.
verses.english: And after this, they went to the camp, and in it, were those who were against them.

verses.latin: Et cum venerunt prope, exclamantes, et deos illorum, supplicabant, ut pro eis mitterent.
verses.english: And when they came near, crying out, and their gods, they implored that they would send for them.

verses.latin: Judas autem, et cum eo erant, orantes, et pro eis, petebant.
verses.english: But Judas, and those with him, praying, asked for them.

verses.latin: Et cum facta esset oratio, et exclamantes, erant impii, et erant, qui de gentibus, qui erant in eis, et in eis, erant ad praelia parati.
verses.english: And when the prayer had been made, and they cried out, the impious were there, and there were some of the gentiles, who were in them, and were prepared for battle.

verses.latin: Et Judas autem et qui cum eo erant, pugnaverunt, et confusi sunt, et fugerunt.
verses.english: And Judas and those with him fought, and were confused, and fled.

verses.latin: Et post haec, ex eis, vulnerati sunt, et ex eis, circiter triginta viri.
verses.english: And after this, some of them were wounded, and about thirty men were killed.

verses.latin: Et Judas, et qui cum eo erant, secuti sunt, et reversi sunt ad castra eorum: et tunc, in eorum exclamantes, et supplicantes, deprecabantur.
verses.english: And Judas, and those with him, followed and returned to their camp: and then, crying out and supplicating, they prayed.

verses.latin: Et venerunt ad castra eorum, et post haec, fugerunt, et ab eis, qui contra eos erant, occisi sunt.
verses.english: And they came to their camp, and after this, they fled, and were killed by those who were against them.

verses.latin: Et in die illo, erant, qui circa vicum, qui est sub montibus, nomine Adasa: et ibi erant in oratione et exclamabant: et post haec.
verses.english: And on that day, there were those near the village, which is under the mountains, named Adasa: and there they were in prayer and cried out: and after this.

verses.latin: Judas autem et qui cum eo erant, post haec, venerunt: et cum eis, exclamabant, et orantes, et post haec, exclamabant.
verses.english: But Judas and those with him, after this, came: and with them, they cried out, and praying, and after this, they cried out.

verses.latin: Et occiderunt, et confixerunt, et erant in die illo, ex eis, circiter trecentos viros.
verses.english: And they killed, and pierced, and on that day, about three hundred men were killed.

verses.latin: Et Judas, et qui cum eo erant, regressi sunt, et praedam acceperunt.
verses.english: And Judas, and those with him, returned and took the spoils.

verses.latin: Et post haec, erant de Jericho, et in Jericho, et circa, et post haec, erant de Adasa.
verses.english: And after this, they were from Jericho, and in Jericho, and around, and after this, they were from Adasa.

verses.latin: Et reversi sunt, et praedam acceperunt. Et post haec, erant de Hierusalem, et post haec, ex eis, et in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And they returned, and took the spoils. And after this, they were from Jerusalem, and after this, from them, and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et dederunt ei, qui erat super eos, de Hierusalem, et qui erant de Hierusalem, et circa, et post haec.
verses.english: And they gave to him, who was over them, from Jerusalem, and those who were from Jerusalem, and around, and after this.

verses.latin: Et cum venerunt ad terram Judae, et ex eis, et in terra Judae, et post haec, erant de Bethsuris, et in Bethsuris, et circa, et post haec.
verses.english: And when they came to the land of Judea, and from them, and in the land of Judea, and after this, they were from Bethsura, and in Bethsura, and around, and after this.

verses.latin: Et venerunt, et post haec, erant de Hierusalem, et ex eis, et in Hierusalem, et ad templum, et in templum.
verses.english: And they came, and after this, they were from Jerusalem, and from them, and in Jerusalem, and to the temple, and in the temple.

verses.latin: Et in illis diebus, et tunc, oraverunt Dominum, et post haec, pro eis, oraverunt.
verses.english: And in those days, and then, they prayed to the Lord, and after this, they prayed for them.

verses.latin: Et post haec, Judaei, et qui cum eo erant, et post haec, oraverunt, et pro eis, petebant, et in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And after this, the Jews, and those with him, and after this, they prayed, and asked for them, and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et tunc, erant in Hierusalem, et orantes, et post haec, erant et erant in templo.
verses.english: And then, they were in Jerusalem, and praying, and after this, they were in the temple.

verses.latin: Et cum pervenissent, dederunt illis pecuniam, et sacrificantes, et post haec, sacrificabant.
verses.english: And when they arrived, they gave them money, and sacrificing, and after this, they sacrificed.

verses.latin: Et cum complessent, et dederunt omnia, et post haec, dederunt pecuniam, et tunc, erant et sacrificabant, et dederunt et sacrificabant, et praedam acceperunt.
verses.english: And when they had finished, and they gave all, and after this, they gave money, and then, they were and sacrificed, and gave and sacrificed, and took the spoils.

verses.latin: Et post haec, cum perfecissent omnia, et omnia, et post haec, dederunt omnia, et sacrificaverunt, et cum ad finem pervenissent, et in illis diebus, et post haec, et in eis, erant, et tunc, et ante, erant.
verses.english: And after this, when they had completed all things, and all things, and after this, they gave all, and sacrificed, and when they had come to the end, and in those days, and after this, and in them, they were, and then, and before, they were.

verses.latin: Et qui in Hierusalem, cum Judaeis, et ad templum, et in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And those in Jerusalem, with the Jews, and to the temple, and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et Judas et qui cum eo erant, ad illos venerunt, et post haec, oraverunt, et post haec, petebant, et post haec.
verses.english: And Judas and those with him, came to them, and after this, they prayed, and after this, they asked, and after this.

verses.latin: Et in illis diebus, festum dedicandi, et in diebus festis, et post haec.
verses.english: And in those days, the feast of dedication, and in the feast days, and after this.

verses.latin: Et in illis, et tunc, laudabant et confitebantur Deo, et laudabant, et in diebus festis, et post haec.
verses.english: And in them, and then, they praised and gave thanks to God, and praised, and in the feast days, and after this.

verses.latin: Et in illis, et tunc, Judaei, qui erant, et qui erant, et post haec, et in Hierusalem, et in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And in them, and then, the Jews, who were there, and who were there, and after this, and in Jerusalem, and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et in illis diebus, post haec, et in Hierusalem, et orantes, et pro eis, et post haec, et in Hierusalem.
verses.english: And in those days, after this, and in Jerusalem, and praying, and for them, and after this, and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quadragesimo nono, cognovit Judas quod Antiochus Eupator veniret cum exercitu in Judaeam,
verses.english: In the one hundred and forty-ninth year, Judas learned that Antiochus Eupator was coming with an army into Judea,

verses.latin: et adduxit secum potentiam multam, et cum eo Alcimus, et posuit eum rex pontificem.
verses.english: and he brought with him a great force. With him was Alcimus, whom the king had made high priest.

verses.latin: Qui confusus fuerat in diebus suis propter suam perfidiam, et coepit percutere populum, et occidere in eis opera sua.
verses.english: He had been disgraced in his own time because of his betrayal, and he began to strike the people and to kill those who were doing his work.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt autem omnes viri impii, et aggregaverunt sibi viros iniquos, et roborati sunt, et dominabantur terrae, et fecerunt gravem plagam in Israel.
verses.english: All the wicked men gathered together and gathered wicked men to themselves, and they became strong, and they controlled the land, and they inflicted a severe plague upon Israel.

verses.latin: Et videns Judas, quod creverunt mala, et quod exercitus in castris contra se erant, et quod tempus instabat ut illi proficerent;
verses.english: And Judas, seeing that the evils had increased, and that the army was in the camps against them, and that the time was approaching for them to advance,

verses.latin: praecepit reliquo populo, dicens: Nolite timere a facie multitudinis, neque formidetis impetum exercitus.
verses.english: commanded the rest of the people, saying: Do not be afraid of the face of the multitude, nor be terrified by the onslaught of the army.

verses.latin: Mementote quanta salus facta est nostris patribus in mari, quando persecutus est eos Pharao, cum exercitu suo.
verses.english: Remember the great salvation that was made for our fathers in the sea, when Pharaoh pursued them with his army.

verses.latin: Et nunc clamaverimus in caelum, et miserebitur nostri Deus, et memor erit testamenti sui, et conteret exercitum istum ante faciem nostram hodie.
verses.english: And now, if we cry out to the sky, God will have mercy on us and will remember His covenant, and He will crush this army before our faces today.

verses.latin: Et perterruerunt eos, et dederunt impetum, et conturbati sunt adversarii.
verses.english: So they terrified them, and they charged, and the adversaries were thrown into confusion.

verses.latin: Et percusserunt ex eis in illa die circiter quinque millia virorum, et vulnerati sunt equites et pedites.
verses.english: And they struck down of them on that day about five thousand men, and the horsemen and foot soldiers were wounded.

verses.latin: Et videns quod coeperant resistere, et audaces facti sunt, audacter se intulerunt adversus eos.
verses.english: And seeing that they had begun to resist, and had become bold, they boldly engaged against them.

verses.latin: Et confusi sunt, et vulnerati multi corruerunt ex reliquis: alii autem fugerunt in castra.
verses.english: And they were confused, and many wounded fell from the rest; others fled into the camp.

verses.latin: Et erat in castris Nicanor, qui de Judaea venerat, et missus erat a rege.
verses.english: And in the camp was Nicanor, who had come from Judea and had been sent by the king.

verses.latin: Qui audiens quod viri Judaeorum fortiores essent, perterritus est, et non sustinuit amplius percutere.
verses.english: Hearing that the men of the Jews were stronger, he was terrified and no longer dared to strike.

verses.latin: Et in die sabbati, exiit Judas cum suis, et exarsit bellum.
verses.english: And on the Sabbath day, Judas went out with his men, and the war flared up.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ex his qui erant in castris, ad invicem: Quid faciemus, quoniam isti Judaei non cessant, sed vadunt ad pugnam?
verses.english: And they said among themselves, “What shall we do, since these Jews do not cease, but go to fight?”

verses.latin: Tunc Nicanor praecepit in die sabbati, ut arma ponerent, et egressi sunt.
verses.english: Then Nicanor commanded on the Sabbath day that they should lay down their arms and go out.

verses.latin: Et circumierunt ad Judaeos, et pugnaverunt contra eos, et ceciderunt ex eis in die illa a trecentis viris.
verses.english: And they went around to the Jews and fought against them, and about three hundred men fell from them on that day.

verses.latin: Judas autem cum suis perrexit ad sepulturam mortuorum, et coeperunt ponere eos cum patribus suis.
verses.english: Judas and his men went to bury the dead, and they began to place them with their fathers.

verses.latin: Et invenerunt sub tunicis occisorum vasa idolis Iamniensium, a quibus prohibitum est Judaeis secundum legem.
verses.english: And they found under the tunics of the slain men the vessels of the idols of Jamnia, which the Jews were forbidden to use according to the law.

verses.latin: Et factum est manifestum omnibus, quod propter hanc causam ceciderunt.
verses.english: And it became clear to everyone that they had fallen for this reason.

verses.latin: Omnes igitur benedixerunt Dominum justum judicem, qui abscondita manifestat.
verses.english: Therefore, all blessed the Lord, the just judge, who reveals hidden things.

verses.latin: Et conversus Judas, exhortatus est populum ut se custodirent a peccatis, quoniam viderant oculis eorum quae facta sunt propter peccatum eorum qui occisi sunt.
verses.english: And Judas, turning back, exhorted the people to guard themselves from sins, because they had seen with their own eyes what had happened on account of the sin of those who had been killed.

verses.latin: Et collectis singulis, misit duodecim viros ad Romam, ut facerent cum ipsis amicitiam, et ut acciperent auxilium ab eis.
verses.english: Then, gathering them individually, he sent twelve men to Rome to make friendship with them, and to receive help from them.

verses.latin: Et legit in ipsis litteras, quibus mandabat ut populum Judaeorum susciperent in amicitiam, et, si qua in eis esset necessitas, auxiliarentur.
verses.english: And he read in them letters, in which they were commanded to receive the Jewish people into friendship and to give them aid if there was any need.

verses.latin: Et egressi sunt in bellum Macedones, et Judas cum suis castravit Casphin, et pugnaverunt.
verses.english: Then the Macedonians went out to war, and Judas and his men besieged Casphin, and they fought.

verses.latin: Et confugerunt qui erant in castris intra moenia, et ceperunt Judaei oppidum.
verses.english: And those in the camp fled within the walls, and the Jews captured the city.

verses.latin: Et facto die, Judas congregavit ex eis virorum duorum millium, et divisit eos in duas turmas ad bellum.
verses.english: And when day came, Judas gathered two thousand men from them, and divided them into two divisions for battle.

verses.latin: Et exarserunt in bellum, et occiderunt ex eis circiter octo millia, et reliquos omnes fugerunt in terram Galathi.
verses.english: And they engaged in battle, and they killed about eight thousand of them, and all the rest fled into the land of Galathi.

verses.latin: In illa autem die, Timotheus, qui erat super castra, captus est ab eis: et vexatus est magna vexatione.
verses.english: On that day, Timothy, who was over the camps, was captured by them and was greatly tormented.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt ad eum fratres, et deprecatis eum dimiserunt: timuerant enim.
verses.english: And his brothers gathered around him, and they beseeched him and let him go, for they were afraid.

verses.latin: Anno centesimo quadragesimo nono, cognoscens Demetrius, quia Romae et qui in Asia erant, timuerant Judaeos, et conturbati sunt propter eos.
verses.english: In the one hundred forty-ninth year of the Seleucid era, Demetrius learned that the Romans and those in Asia were fearful of the Jews and were alarmed by them.

verses.latin: Et congregavit de suis impios, et egressus est.
verses.english: So he gathered his wicked men and went out on a military campaign.

verses.latin: Et venit in terram Judaeae, et venit contra urbem, et congressus est cum exercitu multo.
verses.english: He came to the land of Judea and marched toward the city of Jerusalem. He then fought against a large army.

verses.latin: Et posuit Machabaeus castra contra eum in castris. Et videns exercitum venientem, oravit Dominum, et dixit:
verses.english: And Macabeus (Judas Maccabaeus) set up camp against him and against his army. Seeing his army coming, he prayed to the Lord and said:

verses.latin: Domine, qui antecessisti pro patre nostro in proelio, et projecisti adversarios, et dedisti eos in manus nostras.
verses.english: “O Lord, you have always gone before our fathers in battle, throwing down their enemies and giving them into our hands.

verses.latin: Da et nunc fortitudinem exercitui tuo, et mitte angelum bonum ante faciem nostram.
verses.english: Give our army the strength to fight and send a good angel before us to encourage us.

verses.latin: Et percutiantur timore et tremore virtute brachii tui, et perirent qui blasphemant in sancta nomina tua.
verses.english: May they be struck with fear and terror by the power of your arm, and let those who blaspheme your holy name perish.”

verses.latin: Et congressi sunt, et facta est pugna, et ceciderunt de exercitu Demetrii, et fugerunt, et persecutus est eos a castris usque in Gaze, et omnes qui circa sunt.
verses.english: The battle began, and many soldiers of Demetrius fell and were routed. Judas pursued them from the camp as far as Gaza and the surrounding territories.

verses.latin: Et facta est contritio magna in die illa.
verses.english: The battle brought great defeat on that day.

verses.latin: Porro Jason, qui Judaeos in suam civitatem transtulerat, mille et centum viros, et male tractans eos, et inique agens, in suis se prodidit.
verses.english: Now, Jason, who had transported the Jews to his own city, and who had treated them badly and unjustly, betrayed his own people.

verses.latin: Et qui per omnes vias persequentes erant, et qui cives erant, interfecerunt omnes, et rapuerunt argentum et aurum.
verses.english: Those who were persecuting the Jews along all the roads, and the citizens as well, killed them all and seized their silver and gold.

verses.latin: Et transtulerunt argentum in civitatem, et aliud in Jerosolymam. Et Jason fugavit a Jerosolymis in civitatem.
verses.english: They took the silver to the city and the rest to Jerusalem. Jason fled from Jerusalem to the city.

verses.latin: Qui autem percussus est, in civitatem Arabum fugit: et profligatus est ab Aretam principe Arabum, et in fugam coniectus.
verses.english: The one who was defeated fled to the city of the Arabs and was routed and driven out by Aretas, the prince of the Arabs.

verses.latin: Et persecutus est Jason, in civitatem, et iniquitatem gerens, et pereuntis miserationem, et in alienam coniectus est.
verses.english: Jason was pursued into the city, where he behaved wickedly, and was driven out into exile.

verses.latin: Et qui perrexerant in viam, et in civitatem, Judaei, ccc homines, qui erant in fuga, impetrati, et traditi sunt eis.
verses.english: Then, about three hundred Jews who had gone on the road to the city were captured and handed over to their enemies.

verses.latin: Simul autem et Menelaus in tantam malitiam devenit, et crudelissimus tyrannus, et ad interfectionem civium suorum mandata dedit.
verses.english: Meanwhile, Menelaus became so wicked and was a most cruel tyrant. He gave orders for the killing of his own citizens.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est in Jerosolymam, et Antiochum nequam, et ex omnibus maleficiis suis.
verses.english: He entered Jerusalem with the wicked Antiochus, committing all of his evil deeds.

verses.latin: Et cecidit, quasi in hostes, et cum scelere adveniens, et inique agens.
verses.english: He fell upon the city as if he were an enemy. He came with a scheme to do wrong and acted unjustly.

verses.latin: Et percussit multos ex populo, et asportavit spolia magna.
verses.english: He struck down many of the people and seized great spoils.

verses.latin: Et audiens Judas, qui praeliabatur contra Demetrium, et cum exercitu suo, et revertens in terram Judaeae, confestim profectus est in Berse, et contra Menelaum commisit proelium.
verses.english: Hearing this, Judas, who was fighting against Demetrius with his army, returned to the land of Judea and immediately went out to Berse and fought against Menelaus.

verses.latin: Qui in Jerosolymis, et prope muros, se abscondit.
verses.english: He hid himself in Jerusalem and near the walls.

verses.latin: Et dum Judas bellum instabat, mandavit ad eum rex, mittens milites.
verses.english: While Judas was pressing the battle, the king sent soldiers to him.

verses.latin: Et percussus est Menelaus, et cecidit in proelium, et Judas, profligavit eum.
verses.english: Menelaus was struck down and fell in battle, and Judas defeated him.

verses.latin: Et cum autem ad regem venisset, et iniquitates eorum qui in civitate erant, ostendit.
verses.english: When Judas went to the king, he pointed out the wickedness of those in the city.

verses.latin: Sed et cum rex de eo judicasset, ad mortem eum jussit ire.
verses.english: But when the king judged him, he ordered him to go to his death.

verses.latin: Et cum enim iniquitatem fecerat in civitate, et tormenta posuit, et omnia scelera, idcirco vindicavit in eo.
verses.english: For he had committed wickedness in the city, inflicting tortures and all kinds of crimes. Therefore, he was punished.

verses.latin: Et circa eum erat turba, in circuitu, et in latere, et lapidantes eum, super locum ubi male fecerat, miserunt eum.
verses.english: And a crowd gathered around him and on his side, and they stoned him in the place where he had done wrong.

verses.latin: De his autem, qui cum Menelao erant, multi perierunt: et factus est quasi solus in Jerosolymis, et inique agens.
verses.english: Of those who were with Menelaus, many perished. He was now alone in Jerusalem, acting unjustly.

verses.latin: Et cum ad audientiam venisset, Jason, et ut praestaret, missus est ad Lacedaemonios et inique egit.
verses.english: When Jason came to trial and was sent to the Lacedaemonians, he was found guilty of acting unjustly.

verses.latin: Et qui miserant eum, pro eo, qui per se ipsum, et eadem cum eo, pro eo, quem miserant, missus est.
verses.english: And those who sent him were punished, since he betrayed both himself and the one whom he had sent.

verses.latin: Quod cum audisset rex, iratus est, et punivit eos: et, quia de civitate erant, judicavit, et profligavit, et mortuos fecerunt.
verses.english: When the king heard this, he was angry and punished them. Because they were from the city, he judged them and killed them.

verses.latin: Et multos civium interfecit, et alios dedit militibus ad rapandum, et Jasonem in civitate, et impium, dejecit, et inique agentem in omnes, et profligavit eos in exilio.
verses.english: He killed many of the citizens and gave others to the soldiers to plunder. He cast out Jason, the wicked man, and the one who acted unjustly towards all, and he drove them into exile.

verses.latin: Et reversus est in Arabiam: et in exilio defunctus est, et non habuit qui sepeliret eum.
verses.english: He returned to Arabia and died in exile, and there was no one to bury him.

verses.latin: Et omnes autem qui contra legem et sancta, et iniquitates fecerunt, non effugerunt.
verses.english: And all those who acted against the law, against the holy things, and committed iniquities did not escape punishment.

verses.latin: Nam et ipse Demetrius, dum congressus est cum exercitu, circumdedit eos: et victus est a Machabaeo, et qui cum eo erant, et fugerunt in civitatem.
verses.english: For even Demetrius, while fighting with his army, surrounded them. He was defeated by Macabeus and those with him and fled into the city.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post haec, nuntiatum est Iudae et fratribus ejus, quod Antiochus Eupator venisset cum magno exercitu in Iudaeam,
verses.english: After this happened, Judas and his brothers were told that Antiochus Eupator had arrived in Judea with a large army,

verses.latin: et cum eo Lysias procurator ejus, habens potentissimam partem exercitus, centum et decem milia peditum, et quinque millia equitum, et elephantes viginti duo, et trecentos currus cum falcatis.
verses.english: and with him was Lysias, his regent, commanding the most powerful part of the army: 110,000 infantry, 5,000 cavalry, 22 elephants, and 300 scythed chariots.

verses.latin: Adierunt autem et cum eo, et Iudaei pacem petentes, et periculum ejus abesse cupientes, adversus quos et Lysias suasit.
verses.english: Some Jews also came to him, requesting peace and hoping to avoid danger, and Lysias urged them forward.

verses.latin: Ille vero, non bono modo agens, sed voluntate saeva, ad praedicta Iudaeam et fratres ejus discurrebat.
verses.english: But he, acting with bad intentions and cruel desire, was invading Judea and the brothers who were mentioned previously.

verses.latin: Cumque esset prope Jerusalem, apparuit in visione de caelo eques, armatus aureis armis, et incedens ante eum.
verses.english: As he was approaching Jerusalem, a horseman, armed with golden armor, appeared in a vision from the sky, riding in front of him.

verses.latin: Qui acceptam equitaturam, Lysiae ostendens, ait: Iudaei cum fratribus suis, in hac via, sine timore ambulabant.
verses.english: Showing the mounted troop to Lysias, the horseman said, "Judas and his brothers were walking in this way, without fear."

verses.latin: Et cum esset in conspectu Lysiae, ceciderunt ex equis eorum quasi territi, et effusi sunt.
verses.english: When Lysias saw this, they all fell from their horses, terrified, and were scattered.

verses.latin: Iudaei vero agentes, gratias Deo, et laetantes in his quae fecit, de caelo, ad se missi fuerant, copiosi cum armis ad bellum se paravérunt.
verses.english: The Jews, however, were giving thanks to God, rejoicing in what He had done for them. Those who had been sent from the sky to them, were equipped with weapons, ready to fight.

verses.latin: Et cum prope essent, acriter dimicantes, adversarii vulnerati sunt, et effusi sunt, et ceteri in fugam versi sunt.
verses.english: When they were close, they fought fiercely, and the enemies were wounded and scattered, and the rest fled.

verses.latin: Iudae autem et fratribus ejus, crescente gloria, et virtute, dixit: Non dimicetis contra inimicos vestros, sed maneatis in loco vestro, et simul adoretis Dominum.
verses.english: As Judas and his brothers were gaining glory and strength, he said, "Do not fight against your enemies, but remain in your place and worship the Lord together."

verses.latin: Et exinde, in conspectu eorum, canentes hymnos, et confitentes Domino, qui magnifice operatus est, in eos, consurgentes viri, et fortissimi, dimicantes bellum, vulneraverunt ex inimicis plus quam quinque millia.
verses.english: Then, singing hymns in their presence and giving thanks to the Lord, who had acted wonderfully for them, brave and strong men arose and fought the battle, wounding more than 5,000 of the enemy.

verses.latin: Videns autem Antiochus Eupator, victos exercitus, et fortissimorum militum fugam, timuit, et ad pacem cum Iudaeis, contra volentes, concessit.
verses.english: Seeing his armies defeated and the strongest soldiers fleeing, Antiochus Eupator became afraid and, against his will, agreed to peace with the Jews.

verses.latin: Iudaei autem, cum ad pacem processissent, arma quidem suis civibus tradiderunt, et praesidia ac commeatus, et omnia quae abstulerant, in castra reddiderunt.
verses.english: The Jews, after agreeing to peace, handed over the weapons to their citizens and returned the garrisons, provisions, and everything they had taken to the camp.

verses.latin: Antiochus quoque et Lysias, acceptis omnibus, per Iudaeam, cum laude, reverterunt ad regem.
verses.english: Antiochus and Lysias, after receiving everything, returned to the king through Judea with praise.

verses.latin: Factum est autem post haec, cum ad regem Antiochum redirent, consurgens quidam Philippus, qui erat a consiliariis, et contristatus, dixit regi: Non habemus regnum, et cum praesidio et opibus regimus.
verses.english: After this, as they were returning to King Antiochus, a certain Philip, who was one of the king's advisors and was troubled, said to the king, "We don't control the kingdom; it's being governed with a garrison and wealth."

verses.latin: Sed et Iudaei, qui de Iudaea fugerunt, et nos conturbant, et eorum consuetudinem imitantur.
verses.english: But also, the Jews who fled from Judea are disturbing us and are adopting their customs."

verses.latin: Quam ob rem, dico, oportet nos discedere, et pacificare Iudaeos, alioquin et hi, et qui ex his nos adjuverunt, et nos laedunt.
verses.english: Therefore, I say, it is necessary for us to depart and make peace with the Jews. Otherwise, they and those who have helped them will harm us."

verses.latin: His dictis, statim consurgens Antiochus, furibundus, jussit conficere, et confodi Philippum: qui ex eo, multos dies mortuus est.
verses.english: After saying these things, Antiochus immediately became enraged and ordered Philip to be seized and killed, and he died many days later.

verses.latin: Facto autem magno sacrificio, Iudaei sunt, et filii ejus, ad confractionem templi, et ad eam causam, omnes congregati.
verses.english: After a great sacrifice, the Jews, and his sons, gathered to the destruction of the temple, and for this cause, they all came together.

verses.latin: Facta est autem congregatio, ut viderentur illi: et Iudaei, in loco suo, dimicantes pro lege, et patria, pugnaverunt.
verses.english: The gathering was made so that they would be seen, and the Jews, in their place, fought for the law and their homeland.

verses.latin: Philippus autem, et qui cum eo erant, secesserunt, et pugnabant, et in auxilium eorum qui cum Iudaeis erant.
verses.english: Philip and those with him withdrew and fought, coming to the aid of those who were with the Jews.

verses.latin: Tunc Iudas, congregatus, in loco praefinito, cum ceteris Iudaeis, pugnabat.
verses.english: Then Judas, gathered with the other Jews in the appointed place, fought.

verses.latin: Et clamabat in aure sua: Deus est justus, et fortis. Deus est Justus, et fortis.
verses.english: And he shouted in their hearing: "God is just and strong! God is just and strong!"

verses.latin: Et posuit vexillum, in quo erat aureum signum: omnes autem, qui ad virtutem, et periculum, egressi sunt, perierunt.
verses.english: And he set up a banner, upon which there was a golden sign. Everyone who came forward in strength and danger, perished.

verses.latin: Hostes autem projecti sunt, Iudas vero, filius Matthathiae, praecipue, cum suis, bellum gessit.
verses.english: The enemies were thrown down, but Judas, the son of Matthias, especially, waged war with his men.

verses.latin: Et cum audissent Iudaei famam Iudaei, et ea quae fecerat, timentes, in eorum manibus, sicut erant, manserunt.
verses.english: When the Jews heard of Judas's fame and what he had done, fearing him, they remained in his hands, as they were.

verses.latin: Et laudabant Dominum, qui dedit eis victoriam.
verses.english: And they praised the Lord, who had given them victory.
